alert.note: Alert for Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 04 at 1:43AM PDT until July 05 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR HOT, DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 655... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 655 Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 19 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 80s to lower 90s. * HAINES...6 * IMPACTS...A dry and unstable air mass with warm temperatures can contribute to active fire behavior. In western Washington, significant growth on existing fires takes place under such conditions. If a fire were to begin, air quality may diminish in the surrounding area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Relative humidities will increase overnight Tuesday but again reach critical levels Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either imminent or occurring now. Any fires that develop will likely spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.

area.areaDesc: Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands
